config.description: A simple example to launch an HTCondor job (to sleep)

args.name: cpus
args.description: The number of CPUs to allocate for the job (defaults to 1)

args.name: memory
args.description: The memory (in MB, without writing MB) for the job

args.name: disk
args.description: The disk space (also in GB, without the GB suffix) for the job

args.name: njobs
args.description: The number of jobs to launch of this type (defaults to 1)

config.description: A singularity jupyter notebook or lab to run directly on a remote (e.g., head node)
config.examples:
# Run jupyter notebook on login node with custom container
tunel run-app waffles singularity/socket/jupyter --container=docker://jupyter/datascience-notebook
# Run Jupyterlab login node (via Singularity container) on open science grid
tunel run-app osg singularity/socket/jupyter --jupyterlab=true

args.name: container
args.description: Change the jupyter container used (default is datascience notebook). Must start with container URI to pull (e.g., docker://)

args.name: jupyterlab
args.description: Try running jupyterlab instead (e,g. set to true to enable)

args.name: modules
args.description: comma separated list of modules to load

config.description: An example Django application run via a Singularity container.
config.examples:
# Run app on login node with singularity, custom tag dev
tunel run-app waffles singularity/socket/tunel-django --tag=dev
# Set a custom user/password (note that the UI is only available to you so this is not for security)
tunel run-app waffles singularity/socket/tunel-django --tag=dev --user=hello --pass=moto

args.name: user
args.description: username for logging into Django app (NOT your cluster username), defaults to tunel-user

args.name: pass
args.description: password for logging in to Django app (NOT your cluster password), defaults to tunel-pass

args.name: workdir
args.description: Working directory for app (and to show file explorer for)

args.name: container
args.description: Change the app container used (default is demo ghcr.io/vsoch/tunel-django). Must start with container URI to pull (e.g., docker://)

args.name: tag
args.description: Tag of the container to use (defaults to latest)

config.description: A Jupyter notebook intended to be run with a slurm job, interactive via a port

args.name: workdir
args.description: Working directory for the notebook

args.name: jupyterlab
args.description: Try running jupyterlab instead (e,g. set to true to enable)

args.name: modules
args.description: comma separated list of modules to load

config.description: A Jupyter notebook intended to be run with a slurm job, interactive via a socket.

args.name: workdir
args.description: Working directory for the notebook

args.name: jupyterlab
args.description: Try running jupyterlab instead (e,g. set to true to enable)

args.name: modules
args.description: comma separated list of modules to load

config.description: A jupyter notebook (or lab) intended to be run in a Singularity container.

args.name: jupyterlab
args.description: Try running jupyterlab instead (e,g. set to true to enable)

args.name: workdir
args.description: Working directory for the notebook

args.name: modules
args.description: comma separated list of modules to load
